pr_title: Write out a trace as soon as possible

timeline.bodyText: Please update the class comment with the new flow.
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I debated whether this was necessary or not.
I was also a little hesitant because of how this might work in the late arriving situations.  If we take out one continuation at a time, we'll end up sending small batches.
That will work well for our tests, but I think it is less clear what we want in production.
I suspect this is probably the right choice for production as well since it reduces how long we're holding traces, but we need to verify carefully.
replies.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: So one idea would to be only do direct write when count == 0 if the trace is a rootSpan or it has not been written.
replies.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText: I think this is what you're suggesting, but the write when count == 0 should probably only apply if the root span is finished and not written.
